definition: to win the hearts of the people/to be popular among the masses
deep/depth/deeply/(of a color) dark/deep/rich
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
surname Min
the people/nationality/citizen
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Chinese government is popular with the people because the government brings stability and wealth to the people.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府卻因爲爲人民帶來了穩定和財富而深得民心。

sentences.english: He remained popular throughout his tenure of the office of mayor.
sentences.chinese: 他在擔任市長的整個任期內都深得民心。

sentences.english: Regan remained popular throughout his tenure of the office of president.
sentences.chinese: 里根在擔任總統職務的整個任期都一直深得民心。

sentences.english: Prince William's trip popular, and greatly welcome the public.
sentences.chinese: 威廉王子之行深得民心，大受民衆歡迎。

sentences.english: The action this government has taken against smoking has been very welcome and it deserves credit for that.
sentences.chinese: 政府對吸菸所採取的舉措深得民心並值得稱讚。

definition: to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
